questions.question: A superintendent designs a campaign to reduce near-miss events and raise environmental performance. Which purpose of the Company’s SMS best justifies this initiative?
options: To meet flag state reporting obligations only
To promote HSQE excellence through leadership and a disciplined, documented system
To minimize document storage costs by digitizing records
To limit legal liability after incidents occur
questions.answer: To promote HSQE excellence through leadership and a disciplined, documented system
questions.explanation: The SMS explicitly aims to promote Health, Safety, Security, Quality, and Environmental excellence via strong leadership and a documented management system.

questions.question: You’re auditing the Safety Management System Manual (SMSM). Which set of compliance frameworks should the manual describe according to Company policy?
options: SOLAS and STCW only
ILO Conventions and ISO 14001 only
ISM Code, MLC 2006, and ISO 9001
OCIMF SIRE and TMSA only
questions.explanation: The SMSM’s purpose is to describe compliance with the ISM Code, the Maritime Labour Convention (MLC 2006), and ISO 9001 (Quality Management Systems).

questions.question: A department head is updating SMS documentation. Which of the following is LEAST aligned with what the documentation must include?
options: Clear definition of policies, objectives, and targets within the SMS scope
Defined responsibilities, authorities, and interrelations for staff who affect HSQE processes
Documented procedures and appropriate SMS references
Marketing collateral outlining the company’s brand identity and color palette
questions.answer: Marketing collateral outlining the company’s brand identity and color palette
questions.explanation: System documentation must define scope, responsibilities/authority, and procedures with references—not unrelated marketing materials.

questions.question: During an onboard briefing, the Master asks what event types the crew should report under the SMS. Which answer is most complete?
options: Only nonconformities and incidents
Incidents and personnel accidents; near-misses are optional
Only unsafe acts; unsafe conditions are handled in maintenance
Nonconformities, incidents, personnel accidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and unsafe acts
questions.answer: Nonconformities, incidents, personnel accidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and unsafe acts
questions.explanation: The SMS requires procedures to report and analyze undesired events including all those listed, ensuring systematic learning and prevention.

questions.question: The technical team wants to shift from reactive fixes to a proactive approach. According to the SMS, which maintenance philosophy should be emphasized?
options: Breakdown maintenance only, to optimize spares usage
Condition monitoring and prevention-based maintenance
Calendar-based replacement of all components every year
Vendor-driven maintenance without internal review
questions.explanation: The SMS calls for condition monitoring and prevention-based maintenance to safeguard the ship’s condition.

questions.question: Management asks how the Company evaluates whether the SMS is working effectively. Which combination reflects the required evaluation mechanisms?
options: Quarterly budget reviews and port state MOUs
Internal audits, Management reviews, and Master’s reviews
Class annual surveys and PSC inspections only
External financial audits and charterer vettings
questions.answer: Internal audits, Management reviews, and Master’s reviews
questions.explanation: System performance and effectiveness are evaluated through internal audits, Management reviews, and Master’s reviews per the SMS.

questions.question: The Company plans to establish a new shore office. When determining SMS boundaries and applicability, which factor is most directly relevant?
options: Only the vessel’s load line and deadweight
The Company’s functions, physical boundaries, and organizational units ashore and onboard
The ship’s commercial trading routes
Charter party terms for laytime and demurrage
questions.answer: The Company’s functions, physical boundaries, and organizational units ashore and onboard
questions.explanation: SMS boundaries consider the Company’s functions and physical/organizational units both ashore and onboard, ensuring coverage as the organization changes.

questions.question: A document controller revises procedures for drawings received from equipment makers. Which control must the SMS include?
options: Optional indexing for external documents, no retention of records
Document and data control including documents of external origin, plus record-keeping
Archiving only electronic documents; paper documents are excluded
Retention of non-referenced documents for historical interest
questions.answer: Document and data control including documents of external origin, plus record-keeping
questions.explanation: The SMS requires document/data control (including external documents) and record-keeping to demonstrate compliance and effective operation.

questions.question: A mixed-nationality crew joins a Company vessel. What is the official communication language between the Company and ships, and the common working language onboard?
options: Greek
English
Spanish
Language decided by the senior officer onboard
questions.explanation: The SMS specifies English as the official communication and common working language onboard the ships.

questions.question: A bulk carrier under the Company’s management queries whether the SMS applies to it and to shore-based support activities. What is the correct interpretation?
options: The SMS applies to tankers only, not to bulk carriers
The SMS applies only onboard; shore activities are excluded
The SMS applies to all Company activities and the specified ship types, including bulk carriers
The SMS applies only during audits and inspections
questions.answer: The SMS applies to all Company activities and the specified ship types, including bulk carriers
questions.explanation: The SMS applies to all Company activities and the listed ship types; the document explicitly mentions bulk carriers.
